content.text:
# Draft:Republic of Ireland football clubs in European competitions

Association football Clubs from the republic of ireland representing the [http://League%20of%20Ireland League of Ireland   ]  and the FAI have competed in UEFA competitions since the 1950s. the football association of ireland joined UEFA in 1954.  teams from the League of Ireland and also FAI Cup winners have been chosen   although the relative weakness and  traditionally amateur status  of domestic association football in the republic of ireland has meant success has been limited see sport in the republic of ireland
The Republic of Ireland's domestic football league, the League of Ireland, has traditionally struggled due to a combination of factors, including a perceived lack of investment, a reliance on English clubs for player development, the best irish players tend to play in the English League
Additionally, the popularity of Gaelic Games Gaelic football and Hurling which attract higher number of particants and also spectators, as well as rugby  which is also popular in ireland
the historical dominance of English clubs in Irish football fandom have also contributed to the weaker performance of the League of Ireland.
but on the other hand league of Ireland fans tend to be very passionate and the league has gone through something of a renaissance with both Dundalk and Shamrock Rovers reaching the group stage of European competitions in the last decade.
Dundalk got to the group stage of the Europa league twice
Shamrock Rovers made history by becoming the first Irish club to reach the group stages of a European competition  when they reached the group stages of the 2011-12 UEFA Europa League
Dundalk also reached the group stage of the UEFA Europa League
in the 2016-17 and 2020-21 season
in 2024 -2025 Shamrock Rovers F.C. qualified for Europa conference league  and put in a respectable performance  with 3 wins 2 draws and  one loss and finished 10 out of 36 teams taking part the best performance from a republic of ireland team so far.
the following teams have represented the republic of ireland in european competitions clubs in italics are either no longer in existence or no longer play at senior level

teams from the Republic of Ireland   have played teams from 52 of the 55 UEFA member associations
as of the time of printing  may 2025 they have not played club sides  representing
georgia  montenegro or kosovo
Waterford did play dinamo tbilisi in the 1980-1981 UEFA Cup winners Cup but Dinamo tbilisi  were representing the Soviet Union not Georgia
* Derry City did also represent northern ireland in UEFA european Competitions before the left the irish League and joined the league of ireland  in 1985 see History of Derry City F.C.
PR =Preliminary Round
FR = first Round
SR= Second Round
1QR= First Qualifying Round
2QR= Second Qualifying Round
3QR= Third Qualifying Round
POR = Playoff Round
K.P.P.O = Knockout Phase Play Off
GS=Group Stage
